gui

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object

    Class handles the user interaction:

    • It implements an automaton with states for the different stages of the game.
    • It has state-dependent behavior that controls the display and reacts to key board input from a user.
    • At this point user keyboard input is first dealt with a key listener (SimpleKeyListener) and then handed over to a Controller object by way of the keyDown method.

    The class is part of a state pattern. It has a state object to implement state-dependent behavior.

      The automaton currently has 4 states:
    1. StateTitle: the starting state where the user can pick the skill-level
    2. StateGenerating: the state in which the factory computes the maze to play and the screen shows a progress bar.
    3. StatePlaying: the state in which the user plays the game and the screen shows the first person view and the map view.
    4. StateWinning: the finish screen that shows the winning message. The class provides a specific method for each possible state transition, for example switchFromTitleToGenerating contains code to start the maze generation.

    This code is refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved. Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper.

    Controller holds the keyDown mechanism, but when a robot is enabled it will defer to the robot with this method, in which case the down button is ignored. The robot then instructs the Controller to update the GUI upon completion of operations or errors.

    Author:
    Peter Kemper

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) Order.Builder builder
      The builder algorithm to use for generating a maze.

      reference to the JFrame (MazeApplication) that holds everything

      The current state of the controller and the game.
      (package private) RobotDriver driver
      The driver that interacts with the robot starting from P3
      (package private) java.lang.String driverString
      Used to communicate to Controller what driver should be used.
      (package private) java.lang.String fileName
      The filename is optional, may be null, and tells if a maze is loaded from this file and not generated.
      (package private) float initialRobotEnergyLevel
      Starting energy level of the robot, used to measure energy consumption
      (package private) boolean manualRobotOperation
      Whether or not the robot is operated manually
      private javax.swing.JPanel optsPanel
      Holds options components for selecting maze difficulty, maze type, and driver type
      (package private) MazePanel panel
      The panel is used to draw on the screen for the UI.
      (package private) boolean perfect
      Specifies if the maze is perfect, i.e., it has no loops, which is guaranteed by the absence of rooms and the way the generation algorithms work.
      (package private) Robot robot
      The robot that interacts with the controller starting from P3
      (package private) boolean robotEnabled
      whether a robot will be instantiated
      private java.lang.String robotFailureMessage
      failure message if robot encounters error
      private javax.swing.JPanel sensorButtons
      holds buttons that allow for triggering RobotSensorTrigger sensor failure threads
      private java.util.HashMap<Robot.Direction,java.lang.Thread> sensorThreads
      Threads that induces sensor failure cycles by way of RobotSensorTrigger instances
      (package private) State[] states
      The game has a reservoir of 4 states:
      1: show the title screen, wait for user input for skill level
      2: show the generating screen with the progress bar during maze generation
      3: show the playing screen, have the user or robot driver play the game
      4: show the finish screen with the winning/loosing message
      The array entries are set in the constructor.
      static boolean suppressUpdates
      suppress certain updates from printing, used for testing
      static boolean suppressWarnings
      suppress certain warnings from printing, used for testing

    • Field Detail

      • states

        State[] states
        The game has a reservoir of 4 states:
        1: show the title screen, wait for user input for skill level
        2: show the generating screen with the progress bar during maze generation
        3: show the playing screen, have the user or robot driver play the game
        4: show the finish screen with the winning/loosing message
        The array entries are set in the constructor. There is no mutator method.

      • currentState

        State currentState
        The current state of the controller and the game. All state objects share the same interface and can be operated in the same way, although the behavior is vastly different. currentState is never null and only updated by switchFrom .. To .. methods.

      • panel

        MazePanel panel
        The panel is used to draw on the screen for the UI. It can be set to null for dry-running the controller for testing purposes but otherwise panel is never null.

      • fileName

        java.lang.String fileName
        The filename is optional, may be null, and tells if a maze is loaded from this file and not generated.

      • builder

        Order.Builder builder
        The builder algorithm to use for generating a maze.

      • perfect

        boolean perfect
        Specifies if the maze is perfect, i.e., it has no loops, which is guaranteed by the absence of rooms and the way the generation algorithms work.

      • driverString

        java.lang.String driverString
        Used to communicate to Controller what driver should be used. If no driver to be set, this is null.

      • robot

        Robot robot
        The robot that interacts with the controller starting from P3

      • robotEnabled

        boolean robotEnabled
        whether a robot will be instantiated

      • robotFailureMessage

        private java.lang.String robotFailureMessage
        failure message if robot encounters error

      • driver

        RobotDriver driver
        The driver that interacts with the robot starting from P3

      • manualRobotOperation

        boolean manualRobotOperation
        Whether or not the robot is operated manually

      • initialRobotEnergyLevel

        float initialRobotEnergyLevel
        Starting energy level of the robot, used to measure energy consumption

      • optsPanel

        private javax.swing.JPanel optsPanel
        Holds options components for selecting maze difficulty, maze type, and driver type

      • container

        private java.awt.Container container
        reference to the JFrame (MazeApplication) that holds everything

      • sensorButtons

        private javax.swing.JPanel sensorButtons
        holds buttons that allow for triggering RobotSensorTrigger sensor failure threads

      • sensorThreads

        private java.util.HashMap<Robot.Direction,java.lang.Thread> sensorThreads
        Threads that induces sensor failure cycles by way of RobotSensorTrigger instances

      • suppressWarnings

        public static boolean suppressWarnings
        suppress certain warnings from printing, used for testing

      • suppressUpdates

        public static boolean suppressUpdates
        suppress certain updates from printing, used for testing

      • switchFromTitleToGenerating

        public void switchFromTitleToGenerating(int skillLevel)
        Switches the controller to the generating screen. Assumes that builder and perfect fields are already set with set methods if default settings are not ok. A maze is generated.
        Parameters:
        skillLevel, - 0 <= skillLevel, size of maze to be generated

      • switchFromTitleToGenerating

        public void switchFromTitleToGenerating(java.lang.String filename)
        Switches the controller to the generating screen and loads maze from file.
        Parameters:
        filename - gives file to load maze from

      • switchFromGeneratingToPlaying

        public void switchFromGeneratingToPlaying(Maze config)

        Switches the controller to the playing screen. This is where the user or a robot can navigate through the maze and play the game.

        New for P3: also sets the robot to a fully initialized state

        .
        Parameters:
        config - contains a maze to play

      • communicateSensorTrigger

        public void communicateSensorTrigger(Robot.Direction direction)
        Calls upon sensorThreads to begin the sensor failure cycle for a given sensor.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction of the sensor for which the failure cycle should begin

      • setInitialRobotEnergyLevel

        public void setInitialRobotEnergyLevel(float amount)
        Set the initial robot energy level. Call this only before the robot starts operations.
        Parameters:
        amount -

      • setupRobot

        protected void setupRobot()
        Sets the robot up. Called in StatePlaying when current position and direction have been initialized. Also handles the driver and initializes sensorThreads.

      • switchFromPlayingToWinning

        public void switchFromPlayingToWinning(int pathLength)
        Switches the controller to the final screen
        Parameters:
        pathLength - gives the length of the path

        Set the visibility and activity of sensorButtons.
        Parameters:

      • keyDown

        public boolean keyDown(Constants.UserInput key,
                       int value)

        Method incorporates all reactions to keyboard input in original code. The simple key listener calls this method to communicate input.

        New for P3: If a robot is established and the currentState is StatePlaying, commands that involve operating the robot are delegated to the robot itself, and the Down key is ignored; keys that affect the graphical interface are handled normally

      • keyDownRobot

        public boolean keyDownRobot(Constants.UserInput key,
                            int value)
        Receives keyboard input when a robot is enabled before keyDown. Redirects to the keyDown method of the current state when no driver is enabled. If a driver is active, then the only valid keyboard input concerns adjustment of the maze map visibility. Other keyboard input causes the driver to interrupt prematurely.
        Parameters:
        key - key input value
        value - integer, not used in playing state
        Returns:
        true for valid input, false otherwise

      • turnOffGraphics

        public void turnOffGraphics()
        Turns of graphics to dry-run controller for testing purposes. This is irreversible.

      • setRobotAndDriver

        public void setRobotAndDriver(Robot robot,
                              RobotDriver robotdriver)

        Parameters:

        robotdriver -

        public Robot getRobot()
        Returns:

      • getEnergyConsumedByRobotAtPresent

        public float getEnergyConsumedByRobotAtPresent()
        get energy consumed by robot from start to now
        Returns:
        robot's energy consumption

      • getInitialRobotEnergyLevel

        public float getInitialRobotEnergyLevel()

      • getMazeConfiguration

        public Maze getMazeConfiguration()
        Provides access to the maze configuration. This is needed for a robot to be able to recognize walls for the distance to walls calculation, to see if it is in a room or at the exit. Note that the current position is stored by the controller. The maze itself is not changed during the game. This method should only be called in the playing state.
        Returns:
        the MazeConfiguration

      • getCurrentPosition

        public int[] getCurrentPosition()
        Provides access to the current position. The controller keeps track of the current position while the maze holds information about walls. This method should only be called in the playing state.
        Returns:
        the current position as [x,y] coordinates, 0 <= x < width, 0 <= y < height

      • getCurrentDirection

        public CardinalDirection getCurrentDirection()
        Provides access to the current direction. The controller keeps track of the current position and direction while the maze holds information about walls. This method should only be called in the playing state.
        Returns:
        the current direction
